TextEng: If you can help him, my <lord/lady>, I wish you would. We have no magic here, and my skills are limited.
Text: 도와주실 수 있다면 부탁드려요. 여기엔 마법이 없고, 제 실력으론 한계가 있어서요.

TextEng: Thank you for healing the wizard. I... I tried my best, but ever since I left the service of Lathander, I... oh, but I'm sure you're not interested in little me.
Text: 마법사를 치료해 주셔서 감사해요. 저... 저도 최선을 다했지만, 라샌더님을 떠난 후로는... 아, 저 같은 사람 이야긴 관심 없으시겠죠.

TextEng: Yes, well... I'm glad you were here to help. Thank you.
Text: 네... 와주셔서 다행이에요. 감사해요.

TextEng: Such as they were, perhaps. It is a good thing you arrived... much longer and the poor man might not have made it. It makes me feel... helpless, really.
Text: 그나마 다행이에요. 더 늦었으면 저분이 못 버텼을 거예요. 정말... 무력하네요.

TextEng: Of course. Don't let me keep you, my <lord/lady>.
Text: 물론이죠. 붙잡진 않을게요.

TextEng: That's true, I suppose, though it... it doesn't make me feel much better about being so helpless.
Text: 그건 그렇지만... 무력하단 느낌은 여전하네요.

TextEng: It is just that... once I was a cleric of Lathander. Wounds such as the wizard's were nothing to me. I... I returned people to life! Always I knew my god was with me.
Text: 그게... 저는 한때 라샌더의 성직자였어요. 마법사 정도의 상처는 아무것도 아니었죠. 저... 사람을 되살리기도 했다고요! 항상 신께서 함께하심을 느꼈거든요.

TextEng: But now... now there is nothing. I cannot even help this man, and I feel nothing from Ao. I am beginning to wonder if I was wrong in coming here.
Text: 하지만 지금은... 아무것도 없어요. 이분 하나 도울 수가 없고, 에이오에게서 아무것도 느껴지지 않아요. 여기 온 게 잘못이었나 싶어요.

TextEng: Is that wrong for me to feel this way? You... you are not a holy <man/woman>, my <lord/lady>, but I would appreciate your advice.
Text: 이렇게 느끼는 게 잘못인 걸까요? 당신은... 성직자는 아니시지만, 조언해 주시면 감사하겠어요.

TextEng: Of course, my <lord/lady>. Please forgive me for my presumption.
Text: 물론이죠. 주제넘었다면 용서해 주세요.

TextEng: No, I... I do not know what I was expecting. Not magic, just... I thought Ao was a greater god if he commanded all others, and that one so great deserved contemplation.
Text: 아뇨, 저... 뭘 기대했는지 모르겠어요. 마법은 아니고, 그냥... 에이오가 모든 신을 다스리니 더 위대한 신이고, 그런 분은 묵상할 가치가 있다고 생각했어요.

TextEng: I... yes, I do. It's just that... it seems so pointless to worship someone who takes no notice of you. There is so much good I could be doing elsewhere with the proper power.
Text: 저... 네, 그래요. 다만... 나를 거들떠보지도 않는 분을 숭배하는 게 무의미해 보여요. 제대로 된 힘이 있다면 다른 곳에서 훨씬 많은 선을 행할 수 있을 텐데.

TextEng: I never used to think that power was important, but... back then I could heal people and it felt good. I simply feel so useless here. What should I do?
Text: 예전엔 힘이 중요하다고 생각 안 했는데... 그땐 사람을 치료할 수 있었고 기분이 좋았어요. 여기선 그냥 쓸모없는 느낌이에요. 어떻게 해야 할까요?

TextEng: I suppose it could be, at that. We were never promised an easy path, and I've come so far... to give up now wouldn't make me feel any better.
Text: 그럴 수도 있겠네요. 쉬운 길을 약속받은 적은 없었고, 여기까지 왔는데... 지금 포기한다고 기분이 나아지진 않겠죠.

TextEng: I suppose I have. It just... feels terrible to have come so far just to fail. Or perhaps I just needed to do this, to renew my faith, I don't know.
Text: 그런 것 같아요. 다만... 여기까지 와서 실패한다니 끔찍해요. 아니면 신앙을 새롭게 하려고 이게 필요했던 건지, 모르겠어요.

TextEng: I... I had not considered it like that. You are correct, however... Garrick *is* healed. And perhaps it was through Ao's intervention, after all, who can say?
Text: 저... 그렇게는 생각 못 했어요. 하지만 맞아요... 가릭은 치료됐잖아요. 어쩌면 결국 에이오의 개입이었을지도, 누가 알겠어요?

TextEng: No, I've... never thought about it like that. Perhaps you are right. Perhaps I should forget about magic and focus more on the skill of healing, on medicine...
Text: 아뇨, 저... 그렇게 생각해 본 적 없어요. 맞을지도요. 마법은 잊고 치료 기술에, 의술에 더 집중해야 할지도...

TextEng: Thank you, my <lord/lady>. You've given me much to think about. I will always be grateful for your wisdom.
Text: 감사해요. 생각할 거리를 많이 주셨네요. 그 지혜에 늘 감사드릴게요.

TextEng: I... I see. No, I suppose not. What should I do, then?
Text: 저... 알겠어요. 아뇨, 그렇겠죠. 그럼 어떻게 해야 하나요?

TextEng: I... I see. Maybe you are right, my <lord/lady>. This is a decision I must arrive at on my own.
Text: 저... 알겠어요. 맞을지도요. 이건 제가 스스로 내려야 할 결정이네요.

TextEng: I... must make penance? Do you truly believe that? Yes... perhaps you are right. I have failed not one god but two.
Text: 저... 속죄해야 한다고요? 정말요? 네... 맞을지도요. 한 신이 아니라 두 신을 저버렸으니.

TextEng: Here. Take... take everything I have. I will not need it where I am going. If I am fortunate, perhaps I will find the right path. It is not here, however.
Text: 여기요. 제가 가진 거... 다 가져가세요. 제가 가는 곳에선 필요 없을 거예요. 운이 좋다면 올바른 길을 찾겠죠. 여긴 아니지만.

TextEng: Yes, I've heard of that. There... there is a temple to Lathander there, is there not? And... they need a new cleric, you say?
Text: 네, 들어봤어요. 거기에... 라샌더의 신전이 있죠? 그리고... 새 성직자가 필요하다고요?

TextEng: Thank you, my <lord/lady>, for showing me the way. I will never forget you for this.
Text: 길을 보여주셔서 감사해요. 절대 잊지 않을게요.

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No... no, I understand why you believe that, but I am not ready to follow another faith, my <lord/lady>.
Text: <StartCheck>[실패]</Start> 아뇨... 아뇨, 왜 그렇게 생각하시는지 알겠지만, 다른 신앙을 따를 준비가 안 됐어요.

TextEng: I think it is time for me to return home. Perhaps on the way... perhaps I will have time to think this through. Thank you for your help, my <lord/lady>.
Text: 집으로 돌아갈 때가 된 것 같아요. 가는 길에... 충분히 생각해 볼 시간이 있겠죠. 도움 감사해요.

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You're right. I... I was meant to come here, so I could meet you, and see my true calling for what it is.
Text: <StartCheck>[성공]</Start> 맞아요. 저... 당신을 만나고, 진정한 소명을 깨닫기 위해 여기 오게 된 거였어요.

TextEng: I will return to the civilized lands and take up the worship of your deity. Yes... yes, that is what my heart tells me to do. I am sure of it.
Text: 문명 세계로 돌아가서 당신의 신을 섬기겠어요. 네... 네, 마음이 그렇게 하래요. 확신해요.

TextEng: Thank you, my <lord/lady>. You have given me new hope. I pray we meet again one day.
Text: 감사해요. 새 희망을 주셨어요. 언젠가 다시 만나길 기도할게요.

TextEng: Perhaps I might even become a champion of justice like yourself, or serve those who are. Yes, I think that is what my heart tells me.
Text: 어쩌면 당신처럼 정의의 용사가 되거나, 그런 분들을 섬길 수도 있겠죠. 네, 마음이 그렇게 말하는 것 같아요.

TextEng: It is time to cast aside my concern for others and be strong. Yes... yes, that is what my heart tells me to do.
Text: 남 걱정은 접어두고 강해질 때예요. 네... 네, 마음이 그렇게 하래요.

TextEng: I will return to the civilized lands and learn the worship of <Deity>. Yes... yes, that is what my heart tells me to do.
Text: 문명 세계로 돌아가서 <Deity>를 섬기는 법을 배우겠어요. 네... 네, 마음이 그렇게 하래요.

TextEng: Is that wrong for me to feel this way? I have heard that monks such as yourself are wise and disciplined. Could you not advise me, my <lord/lady>?
Text: 이렇게 느끼는 게 잘못인 걸까요? 당신 같은 수도사는 지혜롭고 수양이 깊다고 들었어요. 조언해 주실 수 없나요?

TextEng: Is that wrong for me to feel this way? You... you are a holy <man/woman>, my <lord/lady>, are you not? Can you not advise me?
Text: 이렇게 느끼는 게 잘못인 걸까요? 당신은... 성직자시잖아요, 그렇죠? 조언해 주실 수 없나요?

TextEng: I... I *was* talking to <him/her>...
Text: 저... 그분이랑 얘기하고 *있었는데*요...

TextEng: I didn't mean it like that...
Text: 그런 뜻이 아니었어요...

TextEng: Is there something you wish, my <lord/lady>?
Text: 무슨 일이세요?

TextEng: Of course, my <lord/lady>. Go in peace.
Text: 물론이죠. 평안히 가세요.

TextEng: If you could direct your questions to the minister, my <lord/lady>, I am sure he would be happy to answer them. I... I am not feeling sociable at the moment.
Text: 질문은 목사님께 해주시면 기꺼이 답해 주실 거예요. 저... 지금은 사람 만날 기분이 아니라서요.

TextEng: I must go, my <lord/lady>. Please do not try to stop me.
Text: 가야 해요. 제발 막지 마세요.

TextEng: I will always be thankful for your arrival, my <lord/lady>. You are truly a godsend.
Text: 오셔서 정말 감사해요. 정말 하늘이 보내주신 분이에요.
